t4.NeuralNet

Class Neuron

  • java.lang.Object
    • t4.NeuralNet.Neuron

  • public class Neuron
extends java.lang.Object
    A Neuron represents one node in a NeuralNet. It has a value and a collection of Bridge inputs, linking it to other Neurons in previous layers.
    Author:
    Teddy

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Bridge[] inputs 
      protected Layer layer 
      protected double value 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Neuron(double value, int numInputs, Layer layer)
      Constructs a new Neuron with the given value, number of input Bridges, and the Layer it resides in.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void backpropagate(double alpha, double f, double d, double payoff, ActivationFunction func)
      Update the values of the weights for the input Bridges connected to this Neuron using the following function:

      w = w + alpha * (d - f) * a' * x

      Where:
      -w is the current weight
      -alpha is the learning rate
      -d is the desired output
      -f is the observed output
      -a' is the derivative of the activation function
      -x is the input value to the bridge's weight
      protected double calculateValue(ActivationFunction func)
      Update the value of the Neuron to be the weighted sum of the Neurons linked via the input Bridges.
      double getOutput(ActivationFunction func)
      Computes the output from this Neuron using the given activation function
      void setValue(double value)
      Sets the value of this Neuron to the given value
      java.lang.String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • backpropagate

        protected void backpropagate(double alpha,
                             double f,
                             double d,
                             double payoff,
                             ActivationFunction func)
        Update the values of the weights for the input Bridges connected to this Neuron using the following function:

        w = w + alpha * (d - f) * a' * x

        Where:
        -w is the current weight
        -alpha is the learning rate
        -d is the desired output
        -f is the observed output
        -a' is the derivative of the activation function
        -x is the input value to the bridge's weight
        Parameters:
        alpha - Learning rate
        f - Observed output
        d - Desired output
        payoff - Payoff of this move
        func - Activation funciton
